*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to James F. Perry, January 3, 1830. Urging him to move to Texas, and showing advantages of doing so at once.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*San Felipe de Austin,*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="01-03-1830">Jany 3, 1830*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr brother and Sister*/p*
*p*Altho, I have written three letters to you within the last two weeks on the subject of your removal to this *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned*, I again repeat the same advise contained in my other letters, least they may have miscarried.*person_mentioned* Dr. Hutchison*/person_mentioned* of the*location_mentioned* Boons Lick country*/location_mentioned* takes on this. He will remove, and perhaps *person_mentioned*Genl T. A. Smith */person_mentioned*(a *person_mentioned*brother*/person_mentioned* of *person_mentioned*Jack*/person_mentioned*'s, tho quite a different man) will also remove in the *date_mentioned n="Fall - 1830">fall*/date_mentioned*. When such men as *person_mentioned*Genl Smith*/person_mentioned* begin to turn their attention this way, you may be sure the *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*must rise. I have lately made an arrangement for a large emigration of *person_mentioned*men */person_mentioned*of the first respectability from *location_mentioned*North Alabama */location_mentioned*round *location_mentioned*Tuscumbia*/location_mentioned*, *location_mentioned*Huntsville */location_mentioned*etc they are all *person_mentioned*men of wealth.*/person_mentioned* Within the last two months one hundred and fifty three *person_mentioned*families */person_mentioned*have arrived and they are generally of the better class and *person_mentioned*men of property*/person_mentioned*. In a year more this *location_mentioned*colony */location_mentioned*will be filled up, now then is the time, if you remove soon you must make a fortune. The land I have asked for, for you and *person_mentioned*Emily */person_mentioned*I have no doubt will be granted—that is *person_mentioned*Eleven Leagues*/person_mentioned* but the title will be void unless you remove. I have asked two years for you to remove in, but am of opinion that only one year will be granted. I can do something for you now but after my colonizing business is done, the door will be closed in comparison to what it is now.*/p*
*p*The whole expenses of a *location_mentioned*League */location_mentioned*to a *person_mentioned*settler */person_mentioned*is about $150, and there is 4, 5, and 6 years to pay a part of that. Many of the *person_mentioned*settlers*/person_mentioned* are poor and will give one half to any one who clears out and pays the expenses on the *location_mentioned*whole League*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*In *date_mentioned n="11-xx-1830">November next*/date_mentioned* the *location_mentioned*custom house*/location_mentioned* will be established and duties collected, for the law which exempted *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*from all duties for seven years will expire in *date_mentioned n="11-xx-1830">November*/date_mentioned*, so that you ought to be here with an assortment of goods before *date_mentioned n="11-xx-1830">November*/date_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Slaves */person_mentioned*cannot be introduced as *person_mentioned*slaves*/person_mentioned*, but as *person_mentioned*indented */person_mentioned*or *person_mentioned*hired servants*/person_mentioned*. I shall start in about *date_mentioned n="01-13-1830">ten days*/date_mentioned* to survey the *location_mentioned*land I have petitioned for*/location_mentioned*, for you, and select a *location_mentioned*building place*/location_mentioned*, and then write more particularly. If you will send on a trusty *person_mentioned*man */person_mentioned*with two or three *person_mentioned*hands */person_mentioned*to build some *location_mentioned*cabins */location_mentioned*it would not be amiss to do so. Stock cattle can be got for goods and if you can bring on a good *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*to put on your land and tend stock you might soon have a 1000 head. Beeves may be shipped *location_mentioned*from the spot to Orleans */location_mentioned*not more than four days run—in fact to include all in a few words you must remove and that immediately.*/p*
*p*My constitution is failing rapidly, and I want you here, to see my *person_mentioned*sisters children*/person_mentioned* all provided for before I die*/p*.
*p*Bring all kinds and barrels of fruit seed of the best kind.*/p*
*p*In dry weather there is a very good *location_mentioned*wagon or carriage road*/location_mentioned* *location_mentioned*from Alexandria to this place*/location_mentioned*. You can take choice of roads either to send everything by water, and bring the *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*out in a carriage from *location_mentioned*Alexandria*/location_mentioned*, or embark the *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*in *location_mentioned*Orleans */location_mentioned*and come by water. The *location_mentioned*road */location_mentioned*is a very good one and much used and it is settled and safe, the *location_mentioned*settlements */location_mentioned*tho are thin. You must bring bedding and furniture. I have nothing of that kind and want some for myself.*/p*
*p*Send your articles or goods to *person_mentioned*James W. Breedlove*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*New Orleans */location_mentioned*with instructions to ship them to *person_mentioned*John Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Brazoria Texas.*/location_mentioned* Also send your letters postpaid by the same channel. Close your affairs in that *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and push on as fast as possible. I have applied for a grant for *person_mentioned*Henry Austin*/person_mentioned* who is now running a steam boat on *location_mentioned*Rio Grande.*/location_mentioned* If you come by land bring a decent carriage, you will need it here, and if not, it can be sold. We are beginning to get up in this *location_mentioned*country */location_mentioned*and decent and fine clothes have taken the place of buckskin.*/p*
*p*Present my respects to my old friend *person_mentioned*Saml Perry*/person_mentioned* and tell him my advise is to quit that cold region and emigrate to *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned*. With his capital he might make a princely fortune here.*/p*
*p*Do the same to my old friend *person_mentioned*John Perry*/person_mentioned* and to his lively and agreeable *person_mentioned*Lady*/person_mentioned*. Why not all come? They can command my friendship, and I can do something for them if they come quickly.*/p*
*p*What are *person_mentioned*Elias Bates*/person_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Honey */person_mentioned*doing? Also *person_mentioned*James Austin's children.*/person_mentioned* I would get them *location_mentioned*land */location_mentioned*if they would come but I shall not write to them anymore for I wished them all to move years ago, and they [have] not even answered my letters. Bring *person_mentioned*Adeline*/person_mentioned*. She can get a league of land and a *person_mentioned*husband */person_mentioned*afterwards.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin.*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
